net.sf.mmm.util.path.base

Class AbstractPathFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractComponent
      • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableComponent
        • net.sf.mmm.util.path.base.AbstractPathFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PathFactory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PathFactoryImpl

    public abstract class AbstractPathFactory
extends AbstractLoggableComponent
implements PathFactory
    This is the abstract base implementation of the PathFactory interface.
    Since:
    5.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • registerProvider

        public void registerProvider(PathProvider provider)
                      throws DuplicateObjectException
        This method registers the given PathProvider.
        Parameters:
        provider - is the PathProvider to register.
        Throws:
        DuplicateObjectException - if a PathProvider is already registered for one of the scheme-prefixes.

      • registerProvider

        public void registerProvider(PathProvider provider,
                             String schemePrefix)
                      throws DuplicateObjectException
        This method registers the given PathProvider.
        Parameters:
        provider - is the PathProvider to register.
        schemePrefix - is the scheme-prefix for which the PathProvider shall be registered.
        Throws:
        DuplicateObjectException - if a PathProvider is already registered for one of the scheme-prefixes.

      • getProvider

        protected PathProvider getProvider(PathUri pathUri)
                            throws ResourceUriUndefinedException
        This method gets the PathProvider for the given PathUri.
        Parameters:
        pathUri - is the PathUri.
        Returns:
        the PathProvider responsible for the given PathUri.
        Throws:
        ResourceUriUndefinedException - if no provider is registered that is responsible.

      • createPath

        public Path createPath(String resourceUri)
        This method creates a new Path for the given resourceUri. The following URI-schemes are guaranteed to be supported:
        scheme example URI
        file file:///tmp/foo.xml
        classpath classpath:net/sf/mmm/util/beans-core.xml
        http http://m-m-m.sourceforge.net/maven/
        https https://github.com/m-m-m/mmm/
        Specified by:
        createPath in interface PathFactory
        Parameters:
        resourceUri - is the absolute URI pointing to the location of the requested Path.
        Returns:
        the requested Path.

      • createPath

        private Path createPath(PathUri uri)
        Parameters:
        uri - is the PathUri.
        Returns:
        the according Path.
        See Also:
        createPath(String)

      • createPath

        public Path createPath(Path basePath,
                       String resourcePath)
        This method creates a new Path for the given parameters. If the given resourcePath is absolute (including scheme), then this method returns the same result as createPath(resourcePath). Otherwise the resource path will be treated relative to the given basePath.
        Specified by:
        createPath in interface PathFactory
        Parameters:
        basePath - is the Path to use if resourcePath is relative. You typically want to provide the parent directory of a resource to navigate from.
        resourcePath - is the absolute or relative path to the requested resource.
        Returns:
        the new path.
